pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:1.13: Sp 1.443: _Tattha kālayuttaṁ samullapantoti kālaṁ sallakkhetvā yadā na añño koci samīpena gacchati vā āgacchati vā tadā tadanurūpaṁ “kacci na ukkaṇṭhasi, na kilamasi, na chātāsī”tiādikaṁ gehassitaṁ kathaṁ kathento_, “‘When they were able, they chatted’: having considered the occasion, whether anyone else was coming or going nearby, they spoke about worldly things, such as, ‘I hope you are not yearning, fed up, and craving.’”
